Detailed Description

template<typename KEY, typename VALUE, typename PAIR_TRAITS, typename TRAITS, class ALLOCATOR>
class cds::map::split_list::details::split_list_impl< true, KEY, VALUE, PAIR_TRAITS, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >

Split ordered list with support of node deletion.

You must not use this class directly. This implementation is automatically selected by SplitOrderedList if garbage collector schema of underlying ordered list TRAITS::ordered_list_type is not gc::no_gc.

See split_list_base for further description of map interface

Member Function Documentation

template<typename KEY , typename VALUE , typename PAIR_TRAITS , typename TRAITS , class ALLOCATOR >
template<typename T , typename FUNC >
bool cds::map::split_list::details::split_list_impl< true, KEY, VALUE, PAIR_TRAITS, TRAITS, ALLOCATOR >::find ( const KEY &  key,
T &  val,
FUNC  func 
) [inline]

Finds key in the split-ordered list. If key is found, returns copy of its value in val.

If key found the function calls user-defined function func with parameters: 

                            void func( T& data, const VALUE& itemValue )

where itemValue is the item found by key. The user-defined function copies the item's value itemValue or its part to data. The list guarantees only that the item found cannot be deleted while func works. The user-defined function func should take into account that concurrent threads may change the item value.

Returns true if the key is found, false otherwise
